headline: Strawberry Pie
description: Strawberry pie is a favorite, and this five-ingredient, picture-perfect version couldn't be easier to whip up. It's a must-try after berry picking!

video.description: You won‚Äôt believe how easy, and tasty, this strawberry pie is.
video.name: Strawberry Pie II

name: Strawberry Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange 1/2 of strawberries in baked pastry shell. Place remaining strawberries in a medium saucepan.
Add sugar to the strawberries in the saucepan; place over medium heat and bring to a boil, stirring frequently.

Whisk cornstarch and water together in a small bowl. Gradually stir cornstarch mixture into boiling strawberry mixture. Reduce heat and simmer mixture until thickened, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour cooked strawberry mixture over berries in pastry shell. Refrigerate until chilled and set, at least 3 hours.
Before serving, whip cream in a medium bowl until soft peaks form. Serve each slice of pie with a dollop of whipped cream.

review.reviewBody: Added about 1/4 of a teaspoon of lemon juice to it at the end to make it more tart. Was delicious
I uses a graham cracker crust .
Really good pie. Everyone enjoyed it!
The only thing I did differently is add 3/4 of orange juice instead of water and half the amount of sugar. Everyone loved it!
Simple. Easy! Delicious!

I used more strawberries than indicated and I followed the recommendation of one review and lined my baked pie shell with melted semi sweet chocolate morsels, melted. I found the pie filling a bit too sweet; may put a little less sugar next time. Overall, a wonderful, easy recipe I'll surely make again.

I followed the tips from ShellyBerry dated 6-19-2006 and it worked out beautifully. "......use more berries (1 1/2 qts.) and less water (only 1/2 cup). You crush 1 cup worth of berries and add the water to that. Mix the sugar and cornstarch together (will blend much better) and then bring the whole thing to a boil. Let it boil for 2 minutes until thick and translucent. Add 1 tbs. butter and let it cool before adding to the crust." Worked like a charm.
Way too sweet and did not set. I cooked sauce until it was like jelly and even added a little agar. Still the pie is liquid after 12 hours of refrigeration. Something is wrong with this recipe.
This was such a simple recipe to follow and was simply delicious. This will be one of our go to‚Äôs this summer.
I very much prefer the jello strawberry pie over this one. tastes like strawberry preserves. Not a fan.
I made this delicious strawberry üçì pie for Easter this year. Easy recipe and delicious! I wish that my strawberries were just a bit more ripe.
Awesome! Substituted Truvia for sugar, as indicated on Truvia label.

I made this for company and it was delicious and so easy. I used a store-bought graham cracker crust. I didn't pour the cooked filling into the shell until it had cooled. Not sure if that was necessary or not. It cooled about 3 hours. The filling was almost overflowing the pie pan so I probably could have used less.

Great base recipe. It's not especially pretty when finished with the mashed fruit poured over. We will probably juice 1/2 of the strawberries and add cornstarch mixture to the boiling juice instead. Great flavor. Some of our berries were not quite ripe. We tweaked this recipe by adding 2 T. of strawberry jam to the boiling mixture. We also used only 1/2 of the sugar and are sure glad we did that. Even so, we ended up putting about a tablespoon of lemon juice into the hot mash to cut the sweet a bit. I did save this recipe, but quite a few tweaks will make it to our taste.
Love it! It was really easy to make. Definitely make again!
Excellent!@@

I followed the recipe exactly but doubled it for two pies, one for now, one to freeze for later. I used my own strawberries from my garden. It was a huge hit and I will definitely be making it again. My husband said it taste like a ‚Äúprofessional bakery‚Äù pie!
Incredibly easy recipe!! You can taste the berries like they were just picked from the berry patch!

Easy to make, few ingredients, quick to cook the strawberries. I used fresh strawberries and a store-bought crust. I reduced the sugar to 3/4 cup, still way too sweet for my European hubby's palate; a bit too sweet for my American palate. In order to get more of the fresh berry taste, next time I will reduce the sugar to 1/2 cup + a tablespoon or so. Thanks for this great recipe!
Very good recipe!! I like to line my crust with 4 oz of cream cheese and powdered sugar mixture. Thank you for a great strawberry pie recipe. Definitely a keeper!!
Easy and beautiful results. It takes a while to set in the fridge so do plan to make it the day before. Also did as others suggested and used 1 1/2 pints of strawberries. This is a crowd pleaser.

Pro tips: add an extra 2 cups of berries to the recipe, use 1 cup of the extra to line the bottom, and the other extra 1 cup to top the pie after pouring in the filling and make sure to brush some of the mixture overtop of them. Don‚Äôt add any water. Add 1 tbsp of lemon juice. You can put the mashed strawberries, sugar and cornstarch all in the pan together and cook it until thickened. Happy baking!
I kept a few more strawberries whole. Very good.

This was so good. I used premade crust. They came 2 in a box and were a little smaller tan 9inchs. This recipe filled both perfectly. The only thing I changed was adding a splash of lemon juice. It enhances the flavour of the strawberries. Great recipe

Absolutely delicious. I made this for a family dinner and everyone had at least 2 slices. I used 1/4 (8 oz) of strawberries for the gelatinous mixture and 4 tablespoons of cornstarch instead of 3, since many reviews said there was a setting problem. This worked very well.

Great tasting glaze (just sweet enough) but mine did not set up. As a side note - I didn‚Äôt adjust my rating for this bc it wasn‚Äôt the receipts fault - but I used a frozen gluten free crust and took another reviews suggestion to melt chocolate Chips and ‚Äúpaint the crust‚Äù. This was not a good idea for the gf crust as it only made it harder. I would not recommend this for a dense gf crust on any pie but I‚Äôm sure it is delicious on a light, flakey traditional crust.

I made this pie as a Mother's Day dessert and it was a big hit. A couple notes... I used two quarts of strawberries overall (1.5 directly in the pie itself, .5 for the glaze). I pureed the strawberries for the glaze rather than mash them. My glaze cooked up more pink than red, so I added a couple drops of food coloring to better match the color of the whole berries. it also came out thicker than I'd expected (more inclined to sit atop the berries than fill between them), so I'll probably step back the cornstarch a bit next time. As soon as the pie shell was done, I turned the oven off, poured about two ounces of chocolate chips into the shell, and left it in the oven for about 90 seconds longer; I then used a spatula to smooth the softened chips into a chocolate coating. The flavor was amazing (a tad sweeter than expected; I might step back the sugar a bit too next time). Really excellent summer pie.
my family is CRAZY about this pie. In early June when the strawberries are the best, I wind up makeing one of these a week, sometimes two! I also added red food dye to darken the color.
Gelatin was very soupy.
Easy to make. I added a cream cheese layer from another recipe.

It‚Äôs not a bad recipe, but I have to agree I couldn‚Äôt make it thicken with the cornstarch mix. So I modified it I did half cornstarch and half Pectin (Liquid or Powder will work) it also cut down on the boiling time and the clarifying time. Also it is much easier to put all your strawberries into a big bowl and add the mixture to them and mix them in the big bowl and then place into your prepared piecrust.
Very good recipe. Made one change, to help keep the pie crust from getting to soggy I spread a thin layer of softened cream cheese over the cooled pie crust before placing the strawberries on it.
Made this pie exactly as the recipe call for and it was fantastic! I will be making it agin tomorrow!
My mom used to use strawberry jello. It was still delicious!!

The flavor of this pie is delicious! My problem was with the measure if strawberries. I googled weight of a quart that the recipe called for since I had a 32oz. package. The answer is rather vague - 1.5 to 2.3 lbs = 1 quart. Well 2 lbs is too much! Although I simmered and stirred the corn starch and mashed strawberry mixture for 10 + minutes - and it thickened a lot - it was not enough to firm up so the pie was a sloppy mess. Also I think you need very ripe soft strawberries to mash them. Will try again with less strawberries because it was very tasty!

Recipe was okay. I find it incomprehensible that any baking recipe does not use weight rather than volume for thing like fruit. Amateur. Nothing wrong with using both weight and volume, of course. But I'd never recommend a recipe where the amount of the main ingredient (here, berries) will vary wildly depending on size and shape of that ingredient.

It was very tasty and super easy to make! Unfortunately, December isn't strawberry season, so I didn't get really great strawberries to work with. 

 I didn't add to the recipe per se, but I did not mash the strawberries. I cut them into teeny tiny pieces, and it made the filling just a little more meaty and thick. What I didn't like about it was it didn't have that clear glaze look like Marie Callanders or Polly's Pies, so I put the topping strawberries on after I put the filling in the pie, and then put a little bit of the filling on top. Next time I might just make a clear glaze for it!
Great recipe, I followed the changes suggested by others and not to sweet. I will double the recipe next time
Five stars pie. It is fresh and natural, the flavor does not change with the preparation. I'm diabetic, so I used Splenda instead of sugar. It worked perfect. Now it is in the list of my favorites.
Very easy recipe and great to mix up a bit. I used strawberries, blackberries, raspberries and blueberries. What a great variety.
The pie was good it was a little flimsy but it was bomb you should definitely try this pie.I refrigerated The pie for two hours maybe I need to do it for longer so it will be stable.

I will definitely make this again - it was a big hit! I did make some modifications based on what others wrote. I used 3/4 c sugar, 2T cornstarch, 1/2 c water, and 1T strawberry jello. I also mashed 1/4 and left 3/4 unmashed and used more like 1 1/2 quarts of strawberries - but I had a deep dish pie crust. I also mixed all the glaze ingredients together in one pot and heated over medium high. I let it boil for about 2 minutes and then cool for 2 minutes. It was perfect! I also folded all the strawberries into the glaze and then filled the pie shell. The pie was perfect!

This was amazing! I had a lot of strawberries and was looking for something to make with them. This will be in our regular rotation from now on! I made it just as directed in the recipe and bought a ready made pilsbury pie crust. Super easy and very good. We used canned whipped cream that we already had on hand. The whole family gobbled it up!

Usually I am irritated by folks that alter recipes but here I am doing just that. 
My husband loves strawberries but with just 2 of us at home, I thought tarts would be better. I read the other reviews and decreased the sugar to ¬æ cup. The filling made 30 small 3‚Äù tarts so I froze them. I read that Tapioca Starch is better where freezing is required. 
THEY WERE GREAT!!
Perfect! The fresh strawberries were delicious. Made it exactly according to the recipe, rave reviews.

Great recipe but took another persons recommendation for 3/4 strawberries 1/4 topping. Better ratio. Also can cut sugar back to 3/4 cup no problem and if strawberries really sweet even cut out more. Loved it and will make again!
I made this exactly as written except I painted the crust with chocolate as one reviewer said. I don‚Äôt think it added much to the recipe. Overall, this was an easy and yummy summer treat!

05-06-17 Very good and super easy to make. Next time I will slice the strawberries and only mash 1/4 rather than 1/2. The pie was set in one hour. Will make again. 07-02-20 Update: I made this again and only mashing 1/4 of the strawberries and slicing the other 3/4 strawberries in half. I used 1/2 cup water instead of 3/4 cup for the cornstarch mixture. My strawberries thickened immediately and I pureed the mixture using an immersion blender. Makes a better presentation.
very good and easy to make! I suggest slicing the strawberries on the bottom in half. A little sweet, so next time I'll try only 3/4 cup sugar.
This was simple and delicious. I had more filling than whole strawberries so it didn't look like the picture but it was very good.

I cut back on the sugar as well, and added the chocolate crust! It‚Äôs been a huge hit. I also doubled the sauce and used 3 pints or 2 lbs of berries. To make a better presentation, save some strawberries to decorate the top. I quartered mine, placed them on top of the gelatin and pushed them in, chilled and served!

Overall, our family liked it, but it was way too sweet so the next time I make this, I'll probably use ¬Ω cup of sugar. Also, I used a frozen pie crust and I think it would taste better in a graham cracker crust.

This is the best Strawberry Pie I can remember eating. I think the key is buying and using home grown strawberries. They have a flavor that you rarely get from store bought strawberries. I can't quit eating it!
It was a delicious pie! I shaped the extra trim of the pie crust into leaves and it looks very nice.
Made this Thursday. It's Sooooo good. Used artificial sugar in it which leaves a waxy after taste, but it didn't change our eagerness to have a piece every night!
This is my husband's new favorite pie! Super easy and delicious!

My 10 year old daughter and I made this pie together. We used a graham cracker crust and it turned out amazing! The not-so-sweet whipped cream combined with the sweet strawberry filling is a perfect match. Our whole family loved it.

As written this is a 4 star recipe. I made it first as written then with reviewer recommended alterations the next time and thereafter and I prefer the version with alterations (use only 1/4 of the berries for the sauce and 3/4 c sugar). I use the "Graham Cracker Crust I" recipe on this site for my crust. I'm surprised I have seen other reviews mention using a graham cracker crust. It pairs wonderfully and it comes together so much faster and easier than pastry.

After reading the reviews, I brushed the pie crust with melted chocolate chips and put in the fridge and then followed the rest of the recipe as directed! I served it with cool whip! It was quite the hit! Definitely, will make it again!
very yummy but too sweet. next time I'll cut back on the sugar
My go-to strawberry recipe for years. I always put a layer of softened cream cheese over the bottom of the cooled, baked crust. Adds flavor and keeps the bottom from becoming soggy!

Way too much sugar. I only added .5 cup for the whole pie filling and it was so overbearingly sweet. My pie crust only has 2 tsp of sugar so the sweetness definitely came from the over-the- top listed amount in this recipe. The thickness and texture are 5/5 though.
I made this on a gluten free crust, followed the recipe except kept sugar to 3/4c which I think was perfect.

First time making fresh strawberry pie without store bought packaged glaze. This was really delicious and tasted more flavorful than the restaurant fresh strawberry pie. It costs less to make and it‚Äôs Vegan too because the pie crust I purchased from the grocery store had no dairy. It‚Äôll now be my favorite spring/summer dessert to make. Thank you for this recipe!!

Five stars for easy as pie. We‚Äôve been with out a Shoneys‚Äô restaurant for quite some time. We loved that strawberry pie. This is almost as easy as ordering it off the menu. I did use my own pie crust recipe so that‚Äôs on me. An I really should have mashed the strawberries more, again on me. If you‚Äôre a bit arthritic like me use a blender to pur√©e the berries you‚Äôre using for the filling . The added extra step will make you filling nice and smooth. I was blessed with local super sweet strawberry‚Äôs so I should have cut back on the sugar, but nah it was still awesome.
'Twas a quality recipe
Easy leash and delicious

Instead of leaving half of the berries unmashed and mashing the other half, I did 3/4 unmashed and 1/4 mashed, 3T of cornstarch, 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water. I added everything together in the pot and brought to boil for a few min. Need to stir constantly or the bottom will burn.

It takes about 2 pounds or 2 plastic "clamshells" of strawberries to make this recipe. The most important step is to reduce the mixture really well or else your pie will be watery. I substituted Xantham gum for corn starch because thats all I had and it turned out fine. Instead of leaving the raw berries in the pie shell I decided to mix them together with the jam in order to make a more uniform filling before pouring everything into the pie.

Very good! Used 3/4 cup sugar. Mashed one cup of strawberries rather than 1/4 of entire strawberries. Made in deep dish pie plate. Strongly suggest making this the night before to let it set up over 12 hours. Purchased 3 lbs of strawberries to make this pie.
Delicious! Thank you!

Made it as written. Five stars. Second time dissolved corn starch in 1/2 cup of water and reduced sugar to 3/4 cup. Started everything in pot together. Brought to boil and let boil for a couple of minutes. I mash about half the fruit. I‚Äôve made with strawberry, peaches, and kiwi. All delicious.
Delicious!!!
Did not use whipped for the topping.
Good but add a couple of tablespoons of powdered sugar to the whipped cream. It is not naturally sweet.
Kept the same, delicious.
My first time making this pie. It turned out way better than I thought I'd do my first time.
Awesome Recipe!
Easy, and yummy! I made it just as the recipe appears.

My strawberries weren't the reddest or most flavorful this time, so I added a little sugarless strawberry Kool-aid to the boiling mixture (not the kind with sweetener). It brightened it right up and added a little oomph. I'm glad I tried it because it's delicious! It reminds me a little of the Danish Dessert gelatin I had as a kid. 5 stars!
I used really ripe strawberries. This turned out so good! Love it.
Perfect

My mother-in-law, Ivy,, made awesome strawberry pies all summer long. As a busy young mom, I sadly just enjoyed them and never got the recipe. With gorgeous berries in season, I suddenly longed for one. This turned out fine for my first ever try. In watching the video, I decided not to put whole berries in first, or to mash the beautiful berries. I used about 1 1/2 qts of berries and after rinsing drying and hulling, set the biggest ones aside. they seemed just too enormously to put in whole. I sliced in half and set aside. The others I sliced for the filling. One thing I do know is that as some other reviewers mentioned, she spread cream cheese on the baked crust and never had a soggy one. She‚Äôd love the idea of using chocolate and I will try that next. The sliced berries in the filling looked great, then I set the the half berries flat side down and used a gel glaze on the top. The edges of my crust we a little messy, but I submitted the photo without the aerosol whipped cream edging I later added. The frozen crust I purchased really wasn‚Äôt thick enough to hold up to the luscious filling. On the plates it looked more like strawberry cobbler, but even so, it was gobbled up quickly and got raves. I will absolutely make again but use the refrigerated roll out crust as it is thicker. I might us the cream cheese on the chocolate layer.
Very easy. good pie but not very sweet.

Super good pie! I also used only about 1/3 of the strawberries for the mashed filling. I melted chocolate and brushed it over the entire crust before adding the strawberries and filling. The chocolate sets it off!
Very good and simple.
Super easy!! A great way to kick off the over-supply of a good day picking.
Definitely a fabulous pie! Will make this over and over again.
I added 1/2 tsp of vanilla and did 1 1/2 cup white sugar and it is so delicious!!
Great recipe. First strawberry pie I've made. It was really easy.to make. I used sugar substitute but otherwise made as specified. Definitely a keeper
Easily made. My new favorite strawberry desert. I also topped mine with homemade whipped topping. Delicious!
Added more berries and sprinkled a little strawberry jello in mixture for color and flavor
I made it exactly as the recipe says except that I used canned whipped cream. It was perfect and wonderful.
Tasty! Simple ingredients and recipe, leaving a natural strawberry taste.
Simple and worth the wait!

I did what Misty said to do. However, my strawberries were not field fresh just those Driscoll store bought harder berries. They weren't super sweet so I kept the sugar at a full cup. The pie was perfect and I left 2/3's of the berries whole and 1/3 mashed and cooked. Used 1/2 cup water. Threw everything in a pot and brought it to a boil till it thickened and the juices were clear, about 3-5 minutes. DELICIOUS! Used a gluten free crust that was the BEST PIE CRUST I EVER MADE. It is in allrecipes under gluten free piecrust It only has 5 reviews and is easy to find, you could substitute regular flour and it would work great.
Loved making this! Easy as pie to make. I hid a little heart in the middle of the pie with the left over pie crust. Not sure if I'll tell my lady... ;)
Oh yes!!!
This pie was wonderful! I followed the recipe except cut the water down to a half cup. It was delicious!
